senses.de: To proceed or continue with something.
senses.ex: Go ahead and start the meeting without me.
cl: don't let me stop you, go ahead

Tips.title: Giving Permission
Tips.description: Used to give someone permission to do something.
Tips.example: Can I use your phone? - Go ahead.

Tips.title: Encouraging someone
Tips.description: Used to encourage someone to start or continue.
Tips.example: I'm nervous about the presentation. - Go ahead, you'll do great!

Tips.title: Starting something
Tips.description: Used to indicate the start of an activity.
Tips.example: Are we ready to begin? - Yes, go ahead.

senses.ex: The concert is going ahead as planned.

Tips.title: Describing events
Tips.description: Used to describe the progression of an event.
Tips.example: Despite the rain, the game went ahead.

proceed.wordDefinition: 'Proceed' is more formal and emphasizes a continuation after a pause or interruption. 'Go ahead' is more informal and general.

continue.wordDefinition: 'Continue' simply means to keep doing something. 'Go ahead' implies permission or encouragement to start or continue.
